solution_line_template: The cost of each pair of jeans is ${shirt_cost} x {jeans_cost_multiplier} = $<<{shirt_cost}*{jeans_cost_multiplier}={jeans_cost_per_pair}>>{jeans_cost_per_pair}.
So {num_jeans_pairs} pairs of jeans amount to ${jeans_cost_per_pair} x {num_jeans_pairs} = $<<{jeans_cost_per_pair}*{num_jeans_pairs}={total_jeans_revenue}>>{total_jeans_revenue}.
Therefore, the store will earn ${total_shirt_revenue} + ${total_jeans_revenue} = $<<{total_shirt_revenue}+{total_jeans_revenue}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue} if all shirts and jeans are sold.
